Reviews.Title: “Our stay at the Ambassade in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Lucy M
Reviews.Content: From the time we walked in the front door, it was a wonderful experience! The rooms are beautifully furnished. The hotel staff were courteous and helpful. The room was lovely and the beds were the most comfortable ones we have slept on in years! The breakfast buffet was delicious, and the servers, Wim and Claudia were friendly and accommodating! We ordered room service one evening and the food was delicious! The whole atmosphere was one of incredible warmth and hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “Full of peace”
Reviews.Author: AysenurErdem
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 4 days. Their customer service is excellent. Everyone was very nice and helpful. It was bitterly cold in Amsterdam at the time. The hotel is near to the canals. It is near to the Dam Square. Will definately stay here again when coming back to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!”
Reviews.Author: loopief
Reviews.Content: Just home from a 3 night stay, and we highly recommend this hotel. It's beautiful, in a central location, but very quiet, with a very peaceful ambience. The room we had (no.17) was on a high floor, with an excellent canal view, Lovely quality bedding and a very comfortable bed. The staff were very proffessional and helpful and made our stay feel very special. The public areas are beautiful, particularly the lounge, and the breakfast is a must! (it even had champagne on the buffet!). Although the hotel isn't huge, it offers the highest of standards in all areas. We will be back, and highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: Susan M
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at many hotels but have never seen one with such beautiful furniture. It's a little tricky getting to some rooms (especially mine), but it was the nicest hotel of my trip. The location is fabulous and so was the massage they referred me to down the street. I did not pay for their breakfast, as the location lent itself to exploring the patisseries along nearby streets. The only objection I had was that I had to pay the full price for a night when in actuality, I only used it for 3 hours. My connection from Detroit was missed due to tornadoes so I purchased an international phone card and called them from the airport to tell them of my dilemma. Even though the tornadoes were 'an act of God' I think that they should have reduced my bill. Perhaps they are so popular that they don't need repeat customers?

Reviews.Title: “Worth every penny”
Reviews.Author: ronpChicago_IL
Reviews.Content: We, too, were visiting amidst uncharacteristically cold weather. Being from North America,we arrived early in the AM, hours before check-out. We were stranded in the lobby and getting crankier by the minute. They were booked solid, so they had no wiggle room. They comped us our breakfast in the dining room and we did get the first room available, an upgrade, at no charge. It was cold in the room, but we dealt with it, later asking staff if we could steal some cardboard to build a barrier in between the windows and curtains. The next day, of their own volition, they called me on my cell phone while sightseeing. They insisted we change rooms for more warmth. Another upgrade at no extra charge. The location is ideal. We walked everywhere we needed to. I can't wait to return, except this time I will book a room to have ready upon arrival.They offer this at 50% discount.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: scottie013
Reviews.Content: We traveled for 3 weeks in Europe in March, 2012. Amsterdam was our first stop and we spent 5 nights at the Ambassade Hotel. Their customer service is the best we had during our vacation. Everyone was very nice and helpful. They even helped us with a connecting flight that we were having trouble with. They had great restaurant recommendations. The location is on a canal and the noise level was not a problem. The staff was the best, the room was large and the location was perfect! We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: SusanTWood
Reviews.Content: I checked into this hotel on January 8th, 2012. It was bitterly cold in Amsterdam at the time ... in fact the canals were frozen over and their were ice-skaters. It was so cold outside that it took your breath away ... Anyway, I checked into the hotel with ease, made my way to the breakfast area and had a lovely, full breakfast - at a table by the window. It was lovely to look outside and warm-up. After breakfast I was told a room was ready for a slight increase ... so I took it. The room was FREEZING cold. I was told the room would heat-up, but it never did. So after diving into a hot bath to warm-up I dug around for blankets ... and still, after three hours I was not warm. Finally, I realized the window was open behind the curtain. When I called to explain I was told this is normal - inferring maybe I should know this (?) - I finally de-thawed a bit and went for a brisk walk. When I came back the room was slightly warmer - but not exactly toasty. The building itself is beautiful. The rooms are nice - not over-done - you know you are in Amsterdam when you are in this hotel. The sitting rooms for tea and the library area are really nice - as is the art around the hotel. The front desk people are absolutely lovely. In spite of my odd temperature experience, I would recommend this hotel without any hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing staff, perfect location, handy, luxurious”
Reviews.Author: LeGrandHongrois
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazingly handy in every aspect. I simply found the hotel in Trip Advisor, never heard about. They rent bicycles themselves, so you are not attached to the time of rental stores. For example you can return the bike in the middle of dawn. Nice and stylish rooms. They upgraded me to a better room with canal view. They respond to all e-mails, request. They are 100%.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff and Wonderful Bed”
Reviews.Author: MrFrench24601
Reviews.Content: We only stayed in the Ambassade one night, but it was the most luxurious of our trip. The staff of this boutique hotel on a quiet canal was very friendly and helpful. They recommended some great restaurants and were very knowledgeable about where to go to get a last minute canal boat ride. From looking at the map, and having never been to Amsterdam, I thought this location might be far from the town center. Rather it was an incredibly close walk to just about everywhere. Amsterdam is much smaller than I expected. I'm glad we ended up in a quiet spot too, since the vibrancy of the city was fun to visit, but wasn't something I'd want to sleep near. And lastly, about sleep. The bed at this hotel was out of this world. We will definitely return there when looking for another luxury get away.

Reviews.Title: “A perfectly located, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: onlooker1
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Amsterdam many times and reached the conclusion that if you want a good hotel, you must pay for it. So, this time I treated myself to a deluxe room with canal view. The room was very well decorated, unusually spacious, and with an excellent view of the Herengracht from a Juliet balcony.The bed had an excellent quality mattress, and is quiet at night so expect excellent sleep. The room was spotlessly clean, as was the modern bathroom. The bathroom had underfloor heating, twin basins and a powerful shower over the bath. The conceirge was smart, professional and very helpful. I highly recommend this hotel, pay around 240 euro a night for a deluxe double room, although at these prices it would be good to have breakfast included; this is a further 17 euros per person. If you go out of the door, turn left down Herengracht and then immediately left there is an excellent bakery with delicious coffee; go there, save money and breakfast with Amsterdammers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but mice problems”
Reviews.Author: PRLSPPOANY
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located, I stayed in a room facing the channel. The room and the hotel were clean, but there were 3 mice in the restaurant where we had breakfast during 4 days (the restaurant is in the street level and the little animals kept going in and out through a hole in the wall). So if you don't mind about having company for breakfast, this hotel is great.

Reviews.Title: “A gem on the canal”
Reviews.Author: rss41
Reviews.Content: This hotel is outstanding and the staff makes you feel like family. It is small and quite personal. The front desk staff is superb and take great pride in making sure that every aspect of your visit is excellent. We had a nice size room, overlooking the canal. Every detail of every day was gladly taken care of by the staff. They even made all the calls and worked through the bureaucracy of the Amsterdam train system to get us a refund for a train trip where the train we booked on had a fire and was cancelled so we had to take a different train. The breakfast room was beautiful and the service was fabulous; again always with a smile. The sitting room next to the breakfast room is beautiful and a lovely place to sit, talk, and relax. An even more relaxing atmosphere can be found in the library, where the books are signed by the authors. This place and its staff are a gem.

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hunabku2012
Reviews.Content: The hotel is charming, the service superb and the location incredible. The best breakfast in bed I have had in years. The rooms are spacious and cozy.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Sergio L
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful experience staying at the Ambassade Hotel in Amsterdam. The hotel is very cozy, the room was quite big and we had a nice view of the canal. The staff was warm and helped us a lot in whatever we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation; lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: Mrsvanm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel during the ash cloud over Iceland. We were detained in Europe for 5 days longer than anticipated, and the hotel staff were wonderful. Very helpful with reservations, day trips, and finding nut-free places for our allergic son to eat. Can't wait to go back. Not luxurious, but like staying with a good friend with maid service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel overlooking canal”
Reviews.Author: LouiseSAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: Spent one night in the charming and traditional Ambassade in room 95 which I would thoroughly recommend. We had an amazing view of the Singel canal and the room had all the mod cons, and a lovely clean bathroom with Rituals toilettries.Service was extremely pleasant, and the public areas including the library were charming. The only downside was the warren of corridors and ups and downs we had to travel to get to our room (despite the lift).....it didn't bother us but I imagine it might not suit everyone. The hotel was also perfectly situated in Amsterdam for exploring the canals. I would also recommend a to Koan Float which is a couple doors along from the hotel. My husband and I both enjoyed a 45 min massage for 50 euros (special price).

Reviews.Title: “Best Bed Ever”
Reviews.Author: Madbenjoel
Reviews.Content: I noticed another reviewer mentioned a saggy bed. Pity they didnâ€™t have my room. The bed was unbelievable and colleagues travelling with me thought the same. Reception: Excellent- Taken to my room and given history of hotel, it was a number of houses joined together, which explains why finding the rooms can be difficult. Rooms- Lovely, spacious, quality fittings, warm, great bath and shower. Overall hard to fault. Location- Short (3-4 min) walk to main shopping area so perfect location. The only problem I had was getting lost because the canals look so alike !! LOL. My only negative was the breakfast was very expensive and not really worth it. Having said that, finding somewhere i Amsterdam that does an early breakfast wasn't easy so convenience was an issue. Overall this was a high quality hotel with professional staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a pitty; crammed room, saggy old beds, messy carpet, building work outside... But great location and (paid) breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Smart_Choice_NL
Reviews.Content: Invited my parents and must have got the oldest, smallest, darkest and crammiest room right under the creeking staircase with saggy beds and not enough room to even walk past another! For that it is totally overpriced as the fab breakfast is extra anyway!

Reviews.Title: “Attractive and well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: KatieO82
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the hotel for one night in January 2012. We found the hotel itself to be extremely well located in a pleasant district (my husband is from Amsterdam, so I can say this with confidence), and within walking distance of the shops, museums and bars. Our room was beautifully decorated and modern, yet very cosy, not to mention spotlessly clean. The en-suite was modern and once again extremely clean. The staff were incredibly helpful and friendly, especially the gentleman that welcomed us upon our arrival. All in all a reasonably priced and thoughtfully decorated hotel, I will definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: P C
Reviews.Content: Staying at the hotel was a great experience with one exception - there was some outside construction noise that started early in the morning. We were staying in a low, street - side room. The staff was very attentive to this issue and decreased the room price because of the inconvenience. The staff was also very helpful and had great recommendations for sight seeing, restaurants, etc. The hotel is perfectly located allowing for easy city viewing with essentially little need for public or private transport.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Old Fashion Fancy Hotel, and Great Price!”
Reviews.Author: CakeVampire
Reviews.Content: Well rated on TA and for a reason. First Location This hotel is near Rozengracht and extremely central to most Amsterdam activities. Walking nearly everywhere was not an issue to say the least. It is surrounded by great shopping ( go a block in just about any direction) and some really great rated TA restaurants are all within a few blocks. There are close main line bus stops if going a further distance (google maps does have public transit guides so just tell it where you want to go to and from and what time to leave and it will tell you what transit to take). The canal it is on is pretty quiet and a lovely view. The Hotel Itself The hotel is a collection of multi-story buildings that are side by side and tied together. It looks amazing, especially if you are in to elegant architecture and decor. It has been expanded over the years and only gotten better. They have a library ( full of books of authors that have stayed there and guest books of all the famous people they have had in their decades), a sitting room, a large dining area, business center (two computers, printer, etc), and a meeting room (along with a few others you probably can accidentally find!). All have grand furniture that is extremely antique and well maintained and the art is very nice also. You just do not find hotels decorated like this any more. The halls are a bit narrow (one person or a squeeze), and while there is an elevator you could end up with one or two half flights of stairs to get to your room (sometimes up and down even!). So while a bit annoying getting to the room the bag boys will take care of your bags, and its really a minor walk. Finding everything in the hotel can sometimes be a bit confusing as the hotel facilities are a bit scattered, any questions through and the front desk is happy to help. The Hotel Room The hotel room is as elegant as the rest of the hotel, and the bathroom is right there with it. Towel heaters, heated tiles, nice counters, and nice shower. The room might be a slight bit on the small side but still enough room for two people in one of their small rooms with a few suitcases I believe. Bed was very good and got some great sleep. While the breakfast is a bit pricey it may be worthwhile as its quite the spread and served in a very elegant area. There are cheaper options but for a nice time at the hotel it certainly is recommended. There is free wifi throughout the hotel and it worked well. The hotel staff seemed friendly enough and the frontdesk was always very helpful (and can be used to buy various local things like bus and tram passes too). When you leave you are expected to leave your key with the frontdesk and they will hand it back to you when you return (its got a big bell on it so far better than carrying it!). Finally the price is excellent for really what is a top venue hotel. I couldn't believe the level of service and quality of hotel for such an affordable price, I would have expected 3 times as much for this sort of Ritz.

Reviews.Title: “Review of the ambassade hotel”
Reviews.Author: Svetle_59
Reviews.Content: Really great experience. everything was great.the hotel is typical dutch by the canal.great breakfast,people , service.everything was done on time with pleasant smile and effectiveness.the staff was really helpful,the room was great with a view on the canal.the weather was windy and rainy but yet weâ€™ll remember this trip as a wonderful one.next time again in ambassade hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Family of 5, very comfortable stay”
Reviews.Author: Eric F
Reviews.Content: We're a family of 5 (kids aged 3,6,9) and booked two adjacent rooms (hotel does not have connecting rooms) for our stay over New Years. The rooms were very clean with modern and well functioning appointments. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly. Location is excellent; right in the middle of everything. Tram is a quick walk away. The only thing we would change about our visit is next time we would get two rooms across from each other so that we could get between the rooms more easily. Thanks for a great stay, Ambassade Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms with a view”
Reviews.Author: MarkPLondon_UK
Reviews.Content: I had a 3 night break with family in Amstedam in December. We stayed in an elegant, spacious family room which was perfect for 2 adults and 2 children (15 and 11). Breakfast was delicious, substantial and served in a beautiful canalside dining room with views over the Herengracht. We enjoyed relaxing in the drawing room next door and the library. Staff were friendly and attentive. Good all-day service for drinks and coffee. Location is outstanding near restaurants, shops and flower market. We walked to Anne Frank House, Rijksmusem, Amstelking, Van Gogh Museum, Red Light District etc.

Reviews.Title: “28 years later.....”
Reviews.Author: luxuryhound
Reviews.Content: This is the third time that we have stayed at The Ambassade - the first was on our honeymoon 28 years ago when it was a three star establishment. It has improved over the years and is an excellent choice if you want a well located hotel at a reasonable price in Amsterdam. We were warmly welcomed on arrival and given a city map and lots of information on what to see and do. Our room was a good size (as well as the bed there was a bureau and a table and chairs) it overlooked the canal which, as a previous reviewer said, can be a problem with noise late at night. We were disturbed on Saturday night but Sunday was fine and we slept well. There was complimentary water and fruit in the room which was nice surprise because in a supposedly 5 star hotel in Venice recently we paid 7.50 Euros for a bottle of water from the mini bar!. The 'double' bed was two singles pushed together however when we asked they did make them up as a double which saved us slipping down the gap in the middle of the night! The bathroom was modern and clean and included such things as a magnifying make up mirror, a powerful separate shower and underfloor heating - bliss! One criticism would be the lack of fluffy white towels, the towels were grey hard and had definitely seen better days. At first glance breakfast seems expensive at 17.50 Euros however for that you get fruit, yoghurt and cereals, a bread basket with croissants and four kinds of bread and a plate of cooked meats and cheese in addition to this you can have eggs and bacon or pancakes that are cooked to order. So yes 17.50 is pricey but you get lot of breakfast for your buck! The location of the hotel is superb - it is on a quiet canal but in easy walking distance to plenty of place of interest as well as lots of good places to eat and drink and the main shopping streets too. If you feel daring you can hire bikes from the hotel and go further afield.

Reviews.Title: “Pefect location”
Reviews.Author: Allergictraveller
Reviews.Content: This hotel is at a perfect location. About a block from one of the most busy shopping streets but quiet location on the canal. This is Amsterdam at its best: Boats floating by, lights reflected in the canal, and small winding streets. My room was quaint and huge (especially for Amsterdam standards), personnel friendly, and the halls are adorned with art. The rooms are clean, the beds and bedding new and comfortable (no sneeze factor here despite it being an old building). Unfortunately no fridge or vending machine in the hotel but a grocery store is not too far away, so I could manage with my food allergies. Note that many rooms do not have canal view; ask for one when you book if you prefer.

Reviews.Title: “never ever book this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Makbule E
Reviews.Content: Doesnt worth the price. Because in my last visit wich was last week Ä± stayed there (Ambassade Amsterdam city center). I was informed that the reservation was for four night by my company. at the forth day evening when Ä± came to the hotel Ä± learned that my reservation was for three nights and that they have emptied my room and taken away my personal items and thrown them into an office room without reminding me the check out date and asking me whether Ä± am going to leave or not. I was shocked when Ä± saw all my items were just around the room, some on the table some were hanged and some on the floor.They should have called my agency or me and remind be the check out. So Ä± could prolong my reservation. I may misunderstood the dates but they dont have the right to go into my room and ruin my items. They may take an additional price or add done day. Are all netherlanders so rude Ä± don't think so but this hotel employers and employees certainly are...

Reviews.Title: “Friendly”
Reviews.Author: eyrun_thune
Reviews.Content: The best thing about Ambassade Hotel is the very friendly staff. Always helpful - I had a nice chat in the early hours when went I went for a run - asking for advice on safety. I like the people of Amsterdam. They all meet you as a friend. The rooms were spotless and the hotel is placed next to the beautiful Herengracht. It was like coming into a fairytale when we stepped out of the taxi and walked towards the hotel along the canal. The breakfast is very good if you are not allergic to gluten. They were told in advance but all we got was some loaf (which was fine and toasted) but there was no mÃ¼sli, nuts or anything that could fill my stomach. You pay a lot for only eating yoghurt. The coffee was not to our taste either. The hotel also has some nice areas for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing experiance”
Reviews.Author: nir1234
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ambassade hotel in the middle of November 2011. I recieved a very small room, even without the abbility to open my suitcase conveniently. The view from the room was to the windows of other rooms and not to the canal. I saw other rooms, at the same price, which look lovely, but I was without luck recieving such a room. It is a pitty that the hotel doesn't conduct different pricing for different sizes of rooms. I recommend to ask in advance which room you are getting, or else you might be very dissapointed, like I was.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything; lovely rooms; FANTASTIC staff”
Reviews.Author: Margaret A
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ambassade Hotel recently in early November. I was impressed even before I got to the hotel! In setting up my reservation, I had asked for restaurant recommendations and received an email with a list. Reservations for dinner at two different restaurants were arranged by the hotel for a couple of the nights I was staying there, taking that one task off my mind. Staff - from the concierge to the cleaning personnel - were all friendly, helpful and made me feel very welcome. The hotel itself has much character. While everything is modern in the hotel rooms, the decor is reminiscent of past times. Modern artwork hangs on the walls, but the feel is of a grand, traditional hotel. Breakfast, which costs approximately EUR 17.50 is served in the elegant breakfast room with a view of the canal through large windows. The breakfast spread is very generous with many options including cereals, fruit, smoked salmon and trout, tomatoes, cucumbers, a platter of cheeses and deli meats, breads... the list goes on. You can also order eggs to your liking, as well as pancakes. The location of the Ambassade Hotel makes it perfect for tourists, as it's close to many of the main areas - the Centrum, Western Canal district, Jordaan, and the Museumplein. My full review is on my blog: http://www.suburbantourist.ca/2011/11/review-hotel-ambassade-amsterdam.html

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Tylers_Parents
Reviews.Content: Our room was large, spotless, and comfortable. The bathroom even had a heated floor! The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, friendly and ideally located”
Reviews.Author: Lmg1471
Reviews.Content: Fantastic 3 night stay in this gem of a hotel. Centrally located yet quiet. Great staff and very clean. Rooms on the small side but ideal for short stays. Would definitely return and recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint and quiet”
Reviews.Author: Hunterboeuf
Reviews.Content: The Ambassade is a beautiful boutique hotel, set between two canals in a quiet area. It is within an easy walk of the Anne Frank house and right in the Nine Streets area with lots of interesting cafes and shops. The hotel is exceptionally well maintained. The staff are very courteous and helpful. It is a bit of a hike to the Van Gogh museum and the Rijksmuseum but easily walkable, or the tram is very close by that goes right there. Best of all is simply walking beside the canals and exploring the alleyways. It is a bit pricier than staying closer to the train station, but well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A terrific hotel in every respect.”
Reviews.Author: Andycat1
Reviews.Content: We are fussy and can't think of anything critical to say about this hotel. Service, cleanliness, room size, breakfast, location and everything else were wonderful and, considering the quality, the cost was quite reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “feel amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: adytrip
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the ambassade in Oct staff: respectful,professional location : ideal room: standard.clean,cosy price:reasonable

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: Dom H
Reviews.Content: This is not only a beautiful, picturesque hotel but it is staffed by the friendliest people in the world. The rooms are lovely, clean and spacious and the location is perfect - close to the center but also lovely and quiet. The library and lounge are great places to relax and work. I stay here when on business in Amsterdam, but would recommend it for anyone over on vacation. It's one of my favorite hotels and I will be back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Ambassade -”
Reviews.Author: deRohan
Reviews.Content: I stayed for three nights at the Hotel Ambassade and loved it! The hotel is elegant and relaxing and is well-located on the Herengracht, right near the fascinating Jordaan area and the "9 streets" shopping district. I was very fortunate to have a room overlooking the Herengracht so I was able to watch all the fascinating passing traffic on the canal. The room was beautifully furnished and fitted out and with the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in in any hotel anywhere in the world! I slept so well! Also a lovely bathroom with lots of nice little extras and lots of hot, fluffy towels. Reception staff were very friendly and welcoming, extremely helpful and very professional. (I arrived at the hotel mid-morning after a long flight from Melbourne, Australia and they did everything possible to have my room available as soon as possible - I was very appreciative of this)! I will definitely stay at the Ambassade on my next trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Service and serenity in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: DeanpW
Reviews.Content: The Ambassade is a collection of canal houses along one of the quieter stretches in the historic canal belt of Amsterdam. The rooms are very comfortable and well-equipped, with fine, spacious bathrooms. Many have good canal views. A real plus for gadget-equipped travelers: There are plenty of outlets. Very comfortable beds. Service is warm and personal and staff are well-versed in area restaurants. We left an item of clothing in the room, but it was found and returned to us in the US in a matter of days. It's really a good location: Convenient to restaurants, shopping and sights, yet quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Houkcast
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from an amazing 3 nights!!! Beautiful room overlooking canal, amazing staff - so helpful with every inquiry we presented. Breakfast was just so-so ( except for amazing croissant and smoked salmon) - but who cares when Toos and Roos is right at the corner. Cannot wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, All good”
Reviews.Author: Davina12
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel a few times and found it to be just great.. Beautiful rooms, second one was overlooking the canal ...excellent location central Amsterdam. Good breakfast, though pricey like most of these hotels. But free wifi and charming staff. Highly recommended. Very comfortable bed too...

Reviews.Title: “Please do stay at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Marlarkey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ambassade last weekend (Friday 30th Sept.) and couldn't have chosen a better weekend weatherwise and hotel-wise. This is a fantastic, well run establishment. The staff were so helpful and friendly, the room was amazing, wonderful bathroom, fantastic view of the canal, we were on the 2nd floor. Huge double bed which was very comfortable. Someone in a previous review complained about the lack of air-conditioning? Ours worked perfectly well, and it was needed as it was so hot. The decor in the hotel is truly wonderful, lots of lovely paintings around the hotel, beautiful library, lovely lounge areas, beautiful fabrics. A lot of thought has gone into the design and layout. Yes the breakfast was really delicious, never had such a wide range of choices and all excellent. Even did a cooked breakfast which is quite unusual for Continental hotels. Well recommended. We only had two days in Amsterdam and felt that we needed more time. There are so many things to see. We visited the Anne Frank house and museum, a truly inspirational and moving experience. Needed a large handkerchief!!! We visited the Van Gogh museum which is also a must. Unfortunately didn't have time to visit many of the other sights as we really needed more time in order to do them justice. The canal trip is worth doing, there are various companies that do this but I think they are more or less the same. There is one that does a museum hop on hop off tour which I think must be worth doing - there's a lot of walking to do in Amsterdam and this sort of trip must take the pain out of aching feet! The attractions are not necessarily close to each other, so plan your day before you go out, Amsterdam is bigger than you think! Beware, if you've never been to Amsterdam before, watch out for bikes and trams. The cyclists seem to have right of way over pedestrians and speed around the city regardless of people! So make sure you watch your step and always look before you step out; watch out for the trams too! There are plenty of restaurants and bars to choose from, spoilt for choice really. Make sure you try one of the pancake houses, delicious. Finally, once again, if you are planning a trip to Amsterdam, give the Ambassade a visit, great!

Reviews.Title: “Great, well run hotel. Perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: Arlene L
Reviews.Content: Let me add my praise to the many fine reviews written in TA about this hotel. Perfect location - elegant canal setting serene, yet convenient. Wonderful, friendly and helpful service from everyone. Very large, clean and comfortable room. (We had one of the attic rooms with a view of the canal.) Large marble bathroom. Make sure you treat yourself to breakfast there at least once. Worth the cost. You can't beat a well-run hotel. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Nan1210
Reviews.Content: The Ambassade Hotel is a lovely, small hotel located in the old part of Amsterdam. My husband and I thought the location was perfect as we could easily walk to museums, restaurants and shops. One of the unique things about the Ambassade is their art collection which is displayed thoughout the hotel, even in the back hallways. It is obvious that a lot of attention is given to detail as all of the decor is tastefully done. We were impressed as soon as we approached the hotel to see a beautiful flower arrangement right outside the door - that was just a hint of what we were to find inside. The staff were all helpful and professional and happy to arrange for our tickets at the museums ahead of time. Our room overlooked the canal and so we had a beautiful view. It was fun to watch the activity down below as soon as the weekend approached.The room's decor was pleasant, the bed very comfortable and the bathroom completely modern and immaculate. We ate breakfast there only once during our 3 night stay as it was a little expensive (especially with our exchange rate), but the choices of food were plentiful and all nicely prepared. I would highly recommend this hotel for a truly memorable stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, very expensive for what it is”
Reviews.Author: Frudle
Reviews.Content: The Ambassade is located centrally in Amsterdam, the staff helpful and polite. Rooms are relatively small, comfortable. That is it. Oh, I forgot - it is expensive. The Amstel (IHG) is probably better value. We were woken up early in the morning (one day) by drilling and hammering. The hotel could not establish where it was coming from so we just put up with it until it all stopped.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful room, centrally located, pretty quiet neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: Gee F
Reviews.Content: We are so glad we found this hotel!! It's on a quiet, beautiful canal street -- Herengracht in the front, and Singel in the back. We had a picture perfect canal view. It's located right next to Spuistraat, which has many restaurants and cafes, pancake houses, etc. There are shops within walking distance as well as the Albert Heijn market on Leidestraat. The staff were incredibly accommodating and very polite, despite our many requests. You can purchase daily tram tickets at the front desk, and their map was extremely helpful. When we got there in the morning, it was before the official check in time, and our room was not ready (reasonable!), so we managed to catch the tail end of breakfast service. It was a magical introduction to the hotel, the canal, and the hospitality. The breakfast is a little pricey, but well worth doing at least once or twice. The dining room is beautifully laid out, with large windows that overlook the canal. Like a fairy tale. Please go and stay in this hotel, esp. if you want to avoid the noise of that Dam square!

Reviews.Title: “Top hotell!!”
Reviews.Author: Vivian E
Reviews.Content: I stayed with friends at the Ambassade hotel for three nights. It is on a nice quiet street but minutes to shopping districts and tourists attractions. Near everything that is the best of Amsterdam! The breakfast is a bit pricey but worth it for the delicious buffet, the extra you can ask for at the possible champagne for breakfast with no extra ccost. Front desk staff was nice and very helpful every time, We will stay here for every visit we make to Amsterdam, I really enjoyed it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: andreaadams
Reviews.Content: My husband, two year old daughter and I stayed at the Ambassade hotel for three nights. It is on a nice quiet street but minutes to shopping districts and tourists attractions. The breakfast is pricey but worth it for the delicious buffet. Room service menu was reasonably priced for the big portions. Front desk staff was courteous and helpful every time, We will stay here for every visit we make to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel - my pocketbook, not so much!”
Reviews.Author: tofinogal
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at Ambassade a few years ago upon the recommendation of a friend - and I loved it so much that I knew one day I'd return with my husband - and I did, last month. I could only afford one night here, it's extremely expensive (my visa bill came in at $500 for one night - I think my rate was 295 euros + taxes), and we had a double room, canal view - but I'm glad we splurged because there's something about staying on the canal and especially on the Herengracht Canal - it's a lovely area for walking (well, all of AMS is good for walking), and we walked to a little restaurant where we were able to eat canal-side (it rained much of the week we were in Amsterdam). The rooms are lovely and in the process of being re-done; breakfast is superb - my husband went to the restaurant and I enjoyed room-service while I sat by the open window and watched people cycling by. The cons of being so close to the street and to the water is the noise at night - but we were fine, there wasn't too much noise the night we were there. While yes it's a labyrinth, it's charming and up and down and all over the place. I just love this hotel but I'm afraid I'll likely not ever be able to afford to go back. Oh, one small thing - it seems that they try to encourage people to do a float-thing - a stress/spa thing - last time I was there they seemed to push it a bit, too. I chose not to do it - must be a money-maker, says the cynic in me. Overall though, would definitely recommend. Rated 4 instead of 5 just because of the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fg82
Reviews.Content: Good location. Close to Jordaan area. Helpful and friendly staff. Clean,but not fancy and somewhat of a labyrinth.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint with excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: GWUGrad
Reviews.Content: Great location, walking distant to all the attractions; yet, in a quiet neighborhood - we slept with the windows open every night - with a beautiful view of the canal. Staff was friendly, informed and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, will definitely come back”
Reviews.Author: canonburyN1
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ambassade with my partner for a two night city break during July 2011 and from the time of check in until the time of departure, the entire experience was a classy and enjoyable one. The hotel is very well situated in a quiet yet central location that's within easy walking distance of all the major sights and attractions. Rooms are individually furnished to an extremely high standard with incredibly comfy beds and beautifully appointed bathrooms. We had booked a room with a canal view on the second floor and weren't disappointed as it had very large windows offering a fantastic vista through the treetops and down to the canal below and with arm chairs positioned so you could sit and take in the scenery after a busy day sightseeing. The hotel offers a great breakfast buffet which while not particularly cheap, is good value for money and of a high standard. There are plenty of options including fruit, cold cuts and cheese, yoghurt, cereals, toast conserves and cooked options such as bacon and eggs made to order. It was slightly disappointing that the hotel lacked a bar for use in the evening but room service can bring up drinks to the room and it's great to watch the world go by on the canal with a drink at the end of a long day. Staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful and were able to offer tips and advice on where to eat, drink and take in the sights. They can also arrange taxis to Centraal Station or other locations in the city. A good tip is that it's worth asking about tickets to popular attractions such as the Van Gogh museum (recommended) at reception as you can often buy tickets there and avoid the queues. All in all, we had a fantastic time and can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly central”
Reviews.Author: JohnTMarlin
Reviews.Content: The challenge for hotels along the Amsterdam canals is maintaining the historic nature of the narrow homes with the needs of a modern hotel. The Ambassade has to make a few compromises in order to keep its exteriors, but we have been coming back year after year and every year there is renovation going on as the hotel expands right through to the next canal. It's hard to beat the location. If you value history and admire brilliant ways to adapt canal residences to make a modern hotel, stay here. The breakfasts are delicious, the public rooms are works of art, and when it comes time to eat out, top restaurants are a block or two away.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: scott10s
Reviews.Content: We arrived early in the morning at about 7am. We knew that was way before check-in time. The staff was great. Everyone was friendly and stored our luggage and showed us to the breakfast room. The food was great. We went out sight-seeing and they had our room ready by noon. The hotel is in a quiet neighborhood and is within easy walking distance to all the attractions, museums and train station. We had a family room with a separate entrance from the rest of the hotel. We loved the room. Again, the staff could not have been nicer and the breakfast every morning was great. Claudia, was our waitress every morning and was so pleasant and nice to chat with each morning. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, wonderful staff, superb location”
Reviews.Author: DebbieDas
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel on Saturday night for a very brief visit to the City. The staff at reception were exceptionally, kind and help and just couldn't do enough for us. Joost Van Der Kwaak led the charge here and was amazing. The rooms are divine, very large and beautifully decorated - the most comfortable beds and pillows - we even managed to get a room with a superb view over the canal. I loved the fact that everything is within walking distance - the museums, flower market etc. Will definitely go back. Yes it's a little pricey but well worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: HibernianFemale
Reviews.Content: Would recommend. Got family room on 3rd floor facing canal. Was perfect for our 5 day stay. Noise from outside has not been a problem, however Today was the very popular 'Gay Pride' canal boat parade and the city is in major party mode. Will expect some revellers later. So glad I chose this hotel as opposed to one nearer Central Station..way to busy, noisy and commercial for my liking..akin to NY streets. Highly recommend 'mike's bike tours' both the City and the Countryside options. Its a short walk from hotel and their bike rentals are cheaper. Breakfast at hotel is expensive although does have decent selection of fare and good service. Staff are pleasant and helpful. A separate concierge would be a good idea as you may find yourself behind a newly arrived visitor who has a slew of questions and just can't wait !!!!. St Nichlauus Boat trip (Boom Chicago) a uique way to travel the canals. The kids enjoyed cycling around the City and the guided tours are the best..as mentioned above. Overall a great trip..bring lots of Euros you will need them!.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Amsterdam Indifference”
Reviews.Author: discovermore
Reviews.Content: The Dutch have a saying that translates to "I do my best"' said with a shrug, often in response to a service complaint. Hotel Ambassade epitomizes the mindset, both in physical appeal and in service. The hotel room - we scored a canal view, so no complaints there - was poorly laid out, the furnishings were incongruous and well worn and the bathroom, hospital-like impersonal. You can get ok rooms and really bad rooms, there is no good (our friend's got a closet). Common spaces are tight and forbidding with the exception of the breakfast room which was well appointed. It seems like the front desk clerks do it all - take reservations, haul bags, answer complaints, make reservations - no investment in bell staff, concierge and guest service. They do their best but sometimes it is just not good enough. I have stayed at other hotels in Amsterdam and as canal hotels go, they are bad in general The only ones better (and pricier) are likely the Dylan and the Pulitzer. Slim pickings.

Reviews.Title: “Dignified and perfectly presented.”
Reviews.Author: nodge94
Reviews.Content: An ideal situation on a peaceful canal. Beautifully appointed, extremely comfortable rooms and excellent breakfast. Staff most efficient and keen to help in any way.

Reviews.Title: “Can't imagine a lovelier hotel”
Reviews.Author: PMarples
Reviews.Content: We had a lovely room, spacious and bright, on the Herengracht Canal within walking distance of everthing in central Amsterdam. Staff members were friendly and helpful. We highly recommend this beautiful hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location to see Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: tayl9512
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Ambassade hotel with my 3 college age children. We picked the hotel because of many good reviews and because of it's location. It is in a nice area of town, one block off a main shopping street but a classic canal zone neighborhood. The hotel consists of series of linked row houses that have been converted into hotel suites. We had one deluxe suite for my wife and I and what they call a triple for the kids (a "living room") and a main bedroom. Given that the buildings date to the 1700s they have done a remarkable job keeping them modern. All have free wifi. The bathrooms are updated and the heating and cooling work well. The people there were polite and usually helpful but professional. The breakfasts were extra but worth every penny with a nice buffet and cooked to order eggs. The breakfast area is charming and bright. On the down side, the windows in our room were far from soundproof and Amsterdam rocks on weekends. Even in our neighborhood, partygoers were in the streets until 3 or 4 am and they SING! It is also not cheap, although we felt it was reasonably valued. Overall a very nice stay, but expensive like most big cities in Europe. And beware of the cabs in Amsterdam. They are totally unregulated and very likely to rip you off. Most don't even have meters!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in every way - a charming small scale boutique hotel with every comfort”
Reviews.Author: Mugster1
Reviews.Content: Spent a two night mini-break in this hotel and can endorse other reviewers' comments. Service is excellent and just the right level of helpfulness, friendly but not overbearing. Staff are very knowledgeable and referred us to two very good restaurants: Luden for a cosy basic meal, and Zuid Zeeland for something more upscale; provided us with tickets for van Gogh and Rijksmuseum - so we could jump the queues. Rooms in the newly decorated part very comfortable, with lots of great touches (free wifi, toiletries, monsoon shower, free water and fruit on arrival, good lighting for reading, windows that actually open, comfy chairs for sitting/reading, super comfy beds and pillows, etc etc). Wonderfully elegant breakfast room, sitting room and library. Great breakfast with good choice and cooked to order excellent. Location is superb - 15 minutes walk from anywhere you might want to go, but very quiet and very picturesque. One of the best hotels of any class we have stayed in for years. I cannot think of a single criticism!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: gryan08
Reviews.Content: Compared to a large chain hotel, this was awesome. Great location, quiet at night, fabulous staff who all speak immaculate English, wonderful canal views. Fantastic breakfast (no lunch or dinner here, like many boutique European hotels), big and comfortable rooms, nothing too much trouble for the staff. Ok, it is quite expensive, but worth it in my opinion. If I ever return to Amsterdam, I won't go anywhere else. Check out the Utube video on the amazing library. There are many places to eat within 5 minutes walk, and both public transport and shopping is within 2 minutes walk. Overall we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and rooms,,,and perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Odedpoznanski
Reviews.Content: There is really only good things to write: the polite and helpful staff, the room, the Location and the beautiful library. Overall it×³s the place to stay in thisvcharming city...

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: RIDGENewYork
Reviews.Content: One of the main reasons we chose this hotel was because it seemed to be so perfectly located for what we wanted to do during our four days in Amsterdam. The Herengracht is absolutely beautiful..........and this hotel is actually a series of gorgeous 17th century houses looking right onto the canal. One of the special treats for us was to look outside our window and watch tour boats, and people on bikes going by quietly and continuously past the beautifully tree lined cobbled streets. While walking to or from the hotel whether you looked up at the wonderfully gabled architecture or enjoyed the bridges it was always delightful. We walked, and walked and walked and really never felt tired. The tram stop at Spui was very near to get to museums and you could easily walk to Dam Square or the Jordaan. Obviously this perfect location would never have warranted five stars if the staff and facility had not also been excellent. We could not be happier with the way we were treated. Everyone was always helpful and courteous and everything on the premises was spotless and very attractive. The breakfast buffet was delicious and available in the elegant dining room also overlooking the canal. This hotel was not inexpensive but if you can splurge a little this is where you want to do it.......it will make your stay in Amsterdam definitely a very special experience !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful location, great ambiance and wonderful staff”
Reviews.Author: marcyf64
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Ambassade and am sure I will return. The location can't be beat. Had a canal front room and felt like I was a local living a very charmed life. Wonderful breakfast room and very attentive staff that goes out of their way to make your stay comfortable and pleasant. Great recommendations for restaurants and any other services you require.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive especially for its cleanliness and service”
Reviews.Author: irene099
Reviews.Content: This is a four star hotel located in the city-centre overlooking the Heerengracht. Despite its central location it is very quiet at night even on the ground floor where we took one of the junior suites. This was imaginatively designed as a sort of mini-maisonette with sleeping area upstairs. The whole set up was spotlessly clean and the service was excellent, unobtrusive but infallibly there when needed. City map was given out unasked but there was thankfully no desperate effort to sell us any extras such as excursions or museum bookings. However, the Reception is happy to do that if asked and they do get a reduction on some events. The hotel provides free internet access and its business centre too is free of charge. The one slight minus point is the breakfast. which is certainly plentiful but rather dull for the price (17 euros 50 per person). There is a lounge with reasonably priced alcoholic and non alcoholic drinks and full room service facilities. All rooms have a mini-bar which is rather expensive. However, as the hotel is near several bars and restaurants, one does not need to be dependent on its eating and drinking facilities. The nearest historical site is Anne Frank's house and St. Francis church both within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, very welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: Time2Travel10
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights at the Ambassade. From the minute we checked in, the service was outstanding. They meet us at the front door and immediately took charge of our large and heavy luggage. We were quickly checked in and escorted up to our room. The canal view was lovely, but it did get a little noisy on the weekends when everyone was out partying on the canal. Comfortable beds, although a little too soft for me, and a big, well-lit bathroom. The breakfast is well worth it, with lots of options - it's served in a beautiful room and again the service is outstanding. The hotel is very centrally located. We walked everywhere - 15 minutes to the Central Station, 20 mintues to the Van Gogh Museum. Lots of restaurants two blocks away. One little downside - there is no bar for a evening cocktail. However, the hotel has 24-hour room service so it was easy enough to order wine or tea in the evening. Overall, a very enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Quaint hotel in quiet area with great staff!”
Reviews.Author: RunningCanuck
Reviews.Content: The Ambassade Hotel is in a quiet area not far from the main shopping streets. The hotel has a library of over 3000 signed books buy authors who have stayed there. Very cool. Although the hotel did not have a gym or pool, it was less than a 10 minute jog to Vondelpark where there are numerous running routes. Go early because it gets busy in the park in the day. The hotel did have original rooms as the hotel is made of 10 separate residences joined together. The high ceilings are a nice feature. Be prepared to walk a couple flights of narrow stairs as well. The staff at the Ambassade made the stay worthwhile. The gentlemen at reception were very helpful and accommodating. The hotel also has bikes for rent which a definite must in Amsterdam. There are many restaurants, drinking establishments and shops in walking distance. We would definitely stay here again. Free wifi was a bonus too.

Reviews.Title: “I am here now”
Reviews.Author: nycmom22
Reviews.Content: The concierges could not be nicer. Indeed, most look like they are moonlighting from their regular job as models for Ralph Lauren catalogs. Triple room not large- but European rooms never are. We have a canal view . Very quiet. As noted, the hotel location is perfect- we have walked everywhere. And very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to reviews on trip advisor”
Reviews.Author: cmyk_br
Reviews.Content: I spent a tremendous amount of time on Trip Advisor (and other sites) reading reviews and felt this research paid off in the case of The Ambassade Hotel in Amsterdam. I only gave it 3 stars for value because it is expensive. That said, I felt I got what I paid for. I would stay here again. I told the staff I had a minor foot problem going down stairs and they gave me a room with easy accessibility. I ended up renting a bike in Amsterdam because for me the city was a bit too big to be walkable. There are 600,000 people in Amsterdam and 2 million bikes. I felt VERY safe in Amsterdam as a solo female traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Real Amsterdam charm and a great location”
Reviews.Author: Busybee81
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the third time at the Ambassade hotel in Amsterdam during a recent business trip back to Amsterdam, and it has been a very pleasant experience yet again. The hotel is a real maze, as it is made of several old Amsterdam houses joined together - but it is exactly this that has allowed this trendy and comfortable hotel to preserve the wonderful authentic charm of true Amsterdam accommodation. The rooms are small, but cute and comfortable, bathrooms clean and well-equipped. The breakfast is served is a beautiful room with a view on one of the most beautiful canals of the city. The location is absolutely marvelous, right in the heart of the best part of the city - however, trying to get thee in your own rental car will be a real challenge, not even mentioning the parking. My advice would be to leave the car for the night at Europark on Marnixstraat and walk or take a cab from there.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, near good dining, gorgeous bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: hbd82
Reviews.Content: It's in a lovely location. Doesn't feel touristy. Nice residential areas are nearby - so you're really close to where the locals live, dine and hang out. Our room was facing the canal on the first floor. If you are picky about location, specify which floor or view you might prefer. We happened to just luck out. Room was cozy/tight - but we didn't need a ton of space considering we were out and about most of the time. Bed was comfortable. Place was clean. Big window view. Bathroom was very nice. Double sinks, full-tub and separate shower area. Lots of space. Up to American standards which are high for bathrooms. Oh, and free wi-fi! Rare in Europe. It's not going to look as polished as maybe a brand new chain hotel - but I think the location is outstanding and it's comfortable. People were friendly - and it is so close to many good restaurants where you'll find the locals. Ten min walk from central station - so no reason for a taxi when you're coming from there.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel!”
Reviews.Author: EL747
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel. I was traveling in Europe and this was by far my favorite place to stay. We arrived earlier before check in and the staff took our luggage while we went out exploring. When we returned, our luggage was in our room. All the hotels we stayed at in Europe stored luggage prior to check in but none of them automatically brought the luggage to the room. Also, the staff got our boarding passes for us, again without asking. They were all so pleasant. The location is perfect...walking distance to everything and near a GVB stop. Our room was great, large and clean. The bathroom was bright and large. The beds were comfortable which is not necessarily the case in Europe. I completely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Sparky22
Reviews.Content: The location of Ambassade Hotel can't be beat. It is walking distance to everything, located on a beautiful canal, and away from the chaotic center. There are great little coffee houses and lunch/breakfast places close by. The staff was great in making super dinner reservations. I provided a list of restaurants I was interested in and they steered me to the ones they get the best feed back from, so we had fabulous dinners. Also, they can sell you tickets to the museums so you can avoid long lines (but you must book Anne Frank's House weeks ahead of time!) Plus, we rented bikes from the hotel--so convenient and very fun. As for the rooms, I would say they are charming but some are a bit dated. The first room we had was equiped with a nice sized lovely bathroom, flat screened tv and big closet. Unfortunately the hotel was under construction--right in front of our room-- and was next to a noisy elevator shaft. We requested a room change and the second room was thankfully quiet, pretty and had a great canal view but a tiny bathroom, tiny closet and an ancient TV. There are no mini-fridges. I am not sure the room was worth 325 euros, but we were still quite happy there, despite having to climb through a construction zone (wet paint, drop cloths, construction workers, etc) each time we went in and out of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in a wonderful city!”
Reviews.Author: Miss84_Loves2Travel
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure what to expect when my friend booked us on a surprise flight to Amsterdam, so I decided to look for the best hotel I could find and came across the Ambassade Hotel. It was perfect! Excellent location which was safe, within walking distance of main areas and very classy and pretty! We had a window view looking out onto the canal and shops/buidlings (the architecture in Amsterdam is beautiful and unspoilt.) The service was impeccable, from the moment we set foot into the building to the moment we left. The staff were highly attentive. We do not usually spend that much time in our hotel as we tend to prefer to explore the city, but during the day we often made trips back to the room (drop off shopping bags/ quick nap before heading out for the evening). The hotel made it all worthwhile. Rooms were very clean, had all the amenities and was decorated in a beautiful and luxurious style. Could not recommend this hotel and the city of Amsterdam any more. Theres so much to see and do- despite the old stereotypes, we found the city to be very classy, rich in culture, with an abundance of museums (we went to a cocktail one too! very random but fun). There are lots of great restaurants- try some Indonesian food- very tasty. Check out the restaurant reviews first though. Go on a boat trip, hit a jazz bar but MIND THE TRAMS & CYCLISTS!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent choice in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: saffronpixi
Reviews.Content: We (daughter and I) were in Amsterdam visiting a friend for a week in November, a beautiful time to visit! Staying at the Ambassade Hotel was a pleasure. We arrived from Paris without a reservation and were greeted warmly by the front desk. We were offered a De Luxe room overlooking the Canal from the 3rd floor which was beautifully furnished, very comfy beds and a modern bathroom with sep.bath/shower. There is free internet, a lovely sitting room and drinks available in the common areas in the evening. There is also a beautiful breakfast room for those who enjoy a large breakfast spread. You can walk to everything and the concierge has tickets available for all the main museums/galleries which would be particularly useful in peak season. The staff were most polite, friendly and obliging, arranging taxis etc. A very good choice for a 3/4 star hotel at 175 Euros per night.

Reviews.Title: “just perfect”
Reviews.Author: irisheyes072
Reviews.Content: staff great.. location excellent. rooms stylish and clean

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly central - and centrally perfect”
Reviews.Author: ian096
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travelled with a teenage daughter and found to our delight that the hotel could accommodate us with a proper triple room - a big double bed and a proper third bed tucked into one part of an L shaped room. The room was warm and comfortable with space for an easy chair and a small table and a good sized bathroom. The hotel is typical Amsterdam, overlooking the Heerengracht and only a few stops south of the Centraalstation by tram. Plenty of good restaurants in nearby Spuistraat. The staff were friendly and welcoming, the breakfasts were plentiful and varied and the building itself is a gem - a whole library given over to personally author-signed copies of lots of books. But beware, this hotel, like many in Amsterdam, is not for those who struggle with stairs; we were two flights up an incredibly narrow winding staircase. But the staff are always willing and able to help take luggage up and down. In short, an ideal location for a City break and reasonably priced for the class of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poor value for money”
Reviews.Author: Tuti_9
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, the best location,but we got a very small double room and seems that most of them are tiny ones. For 245 euros per night and room, no breakfast, I would expect something else.

Reviews.Title: “Restful, relaxing and very comfortable, with good location and great staff.”
Reviews.Author: KapaluaKat
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights prior to our African Safari and then one night on the return home with 4 couples. The staff was so helpful and took care of our requests with a can do attitude and really conveyed they wanted us to enjoy our stay. There are lots of nice hotels to choose from, but the location and the staff make this one very special. Hotel Ambassade is a series of Canal houses that have been linked together in a very charming way. Part of the charm is finding your room! Breakfast is lovely, so be sure to enjoy that too. Don't miss out and book well in advance. We definitely would stay there again when in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: winklet
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for around 5 days in April of this year and would definitely stay there again if finances allow. The staff was very friendly and professional. The room was very nice and clean. We had a room overlooking the canal so that made it even nicer. Free wireless internet in the room. Nice clean bathroom. Comfortable bed. The location is also great, it was pretty much walking distance from everything we wanted to do. It was pretty expensive, but I do believe you get what you pay for - high quality! No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Warm, professional service, great quiet location, lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: retiredtraveler70
Reviews.Content: We chose the Ambassade because it offered triple rooms for two adults and a college-aged son, because it is well located, and because it has a/c. Our triple under the eaves consisted of a main bedroom, a bed in an anteroom that could be closed off from the main room,and a bath. It was more than adequate for our needs, very nicely decorated. The a/c was welcome even though it was relatively cool and rainy during our stay--the first night, mosquitoes came in our opened windows overlooking the Herengracht. Right in the charming Nine Streets boutique shopping area of Amsterdam, a quiet neighborhood with good restaurants, convenient to multiple trams to the main attractions, close to the Anne Frank house. The front desk staff were wonderful, and well equipped with tickets to the museums so you can avoid lines. They reserved a time for us at the Anne Frank house, as well. We didn't breakfast at the hotel--there are cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, superb service”
Reviews.Author: familytravelers54
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately, we stayed only 1 night at the Ambassade, but it was a memorable experience that we would love to repeat. The rooms and amenities were very good, the location on the canal was perfect--but the top-notch staff were really what made the stay special. They were cordial, kind, polite, helpful, attentive, and prompt to all the guests.

Reviews.Title: “EXCEPTIONAL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Robalmar
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recommended to us by a friend who stays here all the time - we loved it! - Great location, the staff were welcoming, informative, professional and friendly - Our room overlooked the canal - well worth the extra $$ as you really get the feel of Amsterdam. The bed was extremely comfortable-well serviced daily and charming. I would very much like to stay here again in the future - well done!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly located hotel”
Reviews.Author: ilovetotravel4
Reviews.Content: My college-aged daughter and I spent three nights at the Ambassade Hotel. The hotel is perfectly situated in the historical section of Amsterdam, on one of the canals. We walked everywhere from the hotel. The staff at the hotel was very helpful getting us online reservations at the Anne Frank House and helping us with other questions we had. The room service was quick and good. We had a room that was at the front of the hotel with only a few steps. The hotel is located in a historic building. We noticed some of the rooms were located up steep steps. The hotel is very clean. We loved it and would most certainly recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff - helpful & welcoming.”
Reviews.Author: EllenL2483
Reviews.Content: Wonderful canal house with view. Very steep stairs made it realistic. Suitcase taken care of immediately - no worries. Superb room service. No problem that I had to cancel second night's stay,

Reviews.Title: “Great Location | Fantastic Art”
Reviews.Author: HeadhunterIndia
Reviews.Content: Very well located, on a well known canal street and seemed to be a short walk from most historic spots. Rooms are charming (mine didnt have much of a view), but through a maze of corridors and lifts. Bathrooms large and well appointed.. Free internet was great. Excellent breakfast spread but poor service in the breakfast area (understaffed?). Front office staff were excellent. The highlight was the fantastic artworks everywhere!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, awesome location, would definitely stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Businesstraveler07
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. We were able to walk to most of the famous sites and those that we couldn't, it was no big deal because we were just steps away from the nearest tram. Also, the hotel is on a side street/canal so it's quiet but you are in the heart of the city. The service was great...the front desk staff was very helpful and knowledgeable about Amsterdam, and if they didn't know an answer they would look it up and get right back to us. The only negative is that you do have to pay for breakfast if you want it, but there are so many great cafes and bakeries nearby that we just grabbed something while we were out. The rooms were beautiful and very clean, and they had all the amenities you would need, ie hair dryer, shampoo/conditioner, lotion, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thornburgh
Reviews.Content: We just got back from Amsterdam, and loved staying at the Ambassade. The front desk staff were the friendliest I've ever seen. They really helped us find things, made excellent recommendations for food and activities, and helped book things for us. The hotel is a charming canal house, and we loved our room with vaulted ceiling and canal view. The extra bed in the entry room was also perfect for our daughter. We'd definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect introduction to Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Tex814
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Amsterdam and we traveled with 2 college aged boys and my 80 year old mother. I had requested a room for my mother near the elevator so she would not have to deal with so many stairs and she was given a wonderful room facing the canal. I booked the rooms directly with the hotel by email and they were very helpful and prompt. All the service was excellent. We were given terrific restaurant recommendations and if we could not get reservations at one they booked us at another great place. I loved the location. It is on Herengracht, a beautiful canal, but it is within easy walking distance of other hot spots. I can't wait to go back and I am shopping for a Dutch bike to use here in Minneapolis

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay, close to attractions, steep stairs”
Reviews.Author: CCG_from_Denver
Reviews.Content: This was a great place in a great location. It is composed of a couple of houses or apartment type buildings just adjacent to the front office, so I had to go out of the front door and 100yds down the street to get to my room, then in a door and into the hall of a building that had maybe 5 rooms. Kind of unusual but that is how it goes when the houses are all really narrow. My room was very, very clean and interesting in layout in that there was a down and upstairs to it (it was a basic room). The downstairs was a very small (12 x 12) sitting room and the bathroom was down there. Then there was a very steep and tight spiral staircase up to the bedroom which was also really nice. Very cool lighting around with dimmers and tv's on each level. If you have mobility issues, probably not for you, if you are a couple looking for a romantic getaway, this is a good place. It rained and they have umbrellas to borrow at the desk. They also rented me a bike, but it was in pretty bad shape (breaks were iffy and the gears did not work) so go to a bike rental place for that because they keep their bikes better. And the place is pronounced "Am bah sahd", like the marquis de sade. I was asking people where it was and I was pronouncing it very incorectly and getting blank stares.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, modest rooms, meagre value”
Reviews.Author: Italophile_Boston_MA
Reviews.Content: Wonderful quiet location facing the Herengracht canal in several old houses. Rooms are gennerally quite small, and those offered to single guests are the smallest of all with narrow single beds in some cases. Breakfast is not included and very expensive if requested. Rooms facing the canal are few in number, but offer the best taste of the city, and this location is quiet; most of the time the loudest nightime noise is the wissh of the bicylcles rushing by.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect long weekend hotel”
Reviews.Author: AGS-London
Reviews.Content: I always search tripadvisor by ranking the lowest rating first. If I can stomach the lowest rating I donâ€™t mind taking the risk. In the Ambassade's case the lower rating commentary in the reviews are complete BS. We stayed in room 49 (4th floor overlooking the canal). The room was lovely, modest in size but clean and well furnished. The hotel also offers a quaint library, lounge, free internet access and an enjoyable breakfast area. The staff are friendly and efficient. The hotel location is not only central but on one of the prettier canals in Amsterdam. Of the hotels of a similar rating I have stayed during past visits to Amsterdam, the Ambassade is the hotel I will return to in future.

Reviews.Title: “Really not bad at all!”
Reviews.Author: JACQUES D
Reviews.Content: Hotel that has great Dutch charm, is located on the Herrengracht. If you decide to go there, you will find a friendly staff who try to do everything for you. Don't miss the Float that is located next door of the hotel for a relaxing and serious massage and more. If you decide to go here, you should specifiy a room with a view...ahuh...on the Canal. Will personally return. A bit expensive, but compared to what?

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: magidale49
Reviews.Content: THe reviews were mainly right on. The Ambassade is an excellent hotel located in the center of Amsterdam. It is on the quiet Herengracht. It is an easy walk to most attrations. The staff was unbelievable. We requested a view of the canal so they automatically upgraded us to a junior suite which was the best room we had during our month long vacation in Europe. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice hotel... But a service and price would make me hesitant to return”
Reviews.Author: chitopher
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. The location was excellent, and the room was outstanding. But I had to argue with the counter girl several times before getting upgraded to an extremely nice room. The rooms are nice but the hotel is difficult to navigate (stairs,hallways,multiple elevators). I would recommend this hotel under certain circumstances (money and a labyrinth hotel aren't an issue).

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel For All Ages”
Reviews.Author: 400CPW
Reviews.Content: A bit late in posting review, but it was such a great experience I had to share. Traveled to Amsterdam with my two girls (7 & 10) for a long weekend and found this hotel was absolutely perfect. Called the hotel to book directly and the reservationist was excellent. We wanted a top notch room and she suggested a suite with a king bed and rollaway to accomdate us. Our room was right on the canal with a huge window that gave us views of all the boats. We had two floors with a bedroom on top and living space below. The kids loved the cool staircase. We actually entered on the street so it was almost like living in an apartment in the city which was very cool too. Two of us shared the bed and the rollaway was in the living room below with room to spare for seating and tv. Travelling with kids can be hairy sometimes and the hotel was very relaxed and accomodating to my kids. Since my husband didn't join us on this trip, my kids sent daily emails from the small but efficient business center and no one raised an eyebrow about kids on the computers. The front desk was also helpful in securing tickets to some of the big ticket attractions. The kids forgot to mail thier postcards on our last day and the front desk even offered to send them out for us. The hotel's location was ideal . There were plenty of restaurants surrounding the hotel so no matter which way we went exploring, we were never at a loss of where to eat. Right around the corner was a busy square with tons of cafes with outdoor tables. The location was ideal for sightseeing too. A very short walk away were a host of must see sights. In fact, everything was so central to the hotel we rarely had to rely on taxis or public transportation. In fact, the public transportion was so clean and easy to navigate that it became our main mode of travel. A main tram hub was right around the corner so that was super convenient and there were plenty of shops right there to buy the tickets. Several tram lines also made frequent stops on the streets surrounding the hotel so we were always able to hop on and off within a few minutes walk of the hotel. Some of the attractions my kids loved, and all within walking distance, were the Ann Frank museum, the Houseboat Museum, drinking hot chocolate at the myriad of canal side cafes and buying our daily snack of french fries in the square by the Ann Frank museum. By tram, we visited the zoo, had dinner at the Hard Rock Cafe and rented bikes to ride at Vongel park. We rented bikes on our last day and regretted not renting for the entire time we were there. Lots of bikes, and very few cars make for a great and safe way to explore the city. Each night my kids ordered bedtime hot chocolate from room service and we found the service to be prompt and very cordial. We ate breakfast in the hotel once but it was too quiet and stuffy for my kids so we decided to grab breakfast around the hotel. There was also a supermarket near the houseboat museum so we stocked up on snacks and made use of the fridge in our suite. Amsterdam was the perfect trip for my kids who found lots of fun and fascinating things to discover and the Ambassde was the ideal place to stay. It offered us the comfort and level of service we expect from hotels but was unique enough to escape the generic hotel room syndrome. It really did offer us a taste of Amsterdam and we loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, centrally located hotel with extremely helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Scotia25
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent two nights at the Ambassade and were very impressed, both with the standard of the hotel and its conscientious staff who went out of their way to help make our stay as pleasurable as possible; this included booking tickets to the Van Gough and Rijks museums in advance to avoid queuing, giving us detailed directions to shops and restaurants and looking after our luggage after we had checked out until we left for the airport.
